messages.subject: full range of thought, was  Learning (was Re: test questions good and bad)
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hmm I don t know of one off hand but we could maybe invent one... let s see an air horn would need to have some way to show that it is a loud sound...but
messages.messageBody:
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, SandraDodd@a... wrote:
>
>
> Is there an emoticon for screaming?
> For an air horn blast?
>
> Sandra
Hmm I don't know of one off hand but we could maybe invent one...
let's see an air horn would need to have some way to show that it is
a loud sound...but also need to be fairly simple so it doesn't take
a lot of work and it doesn't get messed up by different systems
displaying at different resolutions and wrapping and all (can you
tell I work in software testing?lol)

__/)))
\)))

How's that?
two underscores then forward slash then close parenthesis (enter)
two spaces then backward slash then more parenthesis
Curly brackets didn't work as well as parens. I suppose it could be
simplified into

--))))
just to indicate loud sound coming out

Screaming I think is something akin to angry >:-O could probably do
>:-O )))) to indicate Loud Sound with angry to mean screaming

Can you tell it's late afternoon on a Friday here at work?lol

--Deb

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/18/05 1:00:33 PM, soggyboysmom@... writes:


> -=-to point out a flaw in the either/or
> logic - even in FL it's not simply either test OR portfolio-=-
>

Thanks.
It's been a heck of a week and a half or so for all-out either-or
black-and-white dualistic thinking. If we were in person we could have an air-horn to
honk when someone says "Either a person believes this or not." "Either
eating processed food kills you on the spot, or it never does." "Either parents
run the house or the kids do."

Is there an emoticon for screaming?
For an air horn blast?

Sandra
